entries.caption: A DAG for school outcomes that links participation and expenditure as a function of culture.
A graphical causal network relating expenditures, participation percentage, and education outcome, where there is no connection between expenditures and participation.

Data and models of the relationship between expenditures and education outcomes from a simulation in which expenditures and participation rate are unconnected as in @fig-school-sim-1. - (a) The model outcome ~ expenditure - (b) The model with participation as a covariate: outcome ~ expenditure + participation Both models (a) and (b) show the same effect size for outcome with respect to expenditure.

Similar to @fig-school-data-1 but using the simulation in which the explanatory variables – expenditure and participation – are connected by a common cause. The two models show very different relationships between outcomes and expenditures. Model (b) matches the mechanism used in the simulation, while that mechanism is obscured in model (a).
State by state data (from 2010) on average score on the SAT college admissions test and expenditures for public education.
Annual earnings versus age. The lines show fitted models made separately for men (top) and women (bottom).
The model of SAT score versus expenditures, including as a covariate the fraction of eligible students in the state who take the SAT.
